intro: Soldanella alpina f. major, commonly known as the alpine soldanella, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, with five petals. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. This form is characterized by its larger leaves compared to the typical form of Soldanella alpina.
